intro: Cyphostemma humile, commonly known as the small-leaved cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by elongated, fleshy fruits that are edible when mature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing along fences or trees. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
